p: Comorbities such as bronchial asthma, sickle cell anemia, and diabetes mellitus could be risk factors for development of severe disease forms ( Gonzalez et al., 2005). Diabetes mellitus and hypertension were associated with severe disease ( Pang et al., 2012). Also diabetes mellitus, asthma, hypertension, ischemic heart disease, and chronic kidney disease were present in the majority of those who died ( Leo et al., 2011).
